metadata.title: CVE-2024-53141 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:netfilter: ipset: add missing range check in bitmap_ip_uadtWhen tb[IPSET_ATTR_IP_TO] is not present but tb[IPSET_ATTR_CIDR] exists,the values of ip and ip_to are slightly swapped. Therefore, the range checkfor ip should be done later, but this part is missing and it seems that thevulnerability occurs.So we should add missing range checks and remove unnecessary range checks.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-53141` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.8.0-52-generic - 6.8.0-52.53
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-52-generic - 6.8.0-52.53
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-52-generic-64k - 6.8.0-52.53
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1021-azure - 6.8.0-1021.25
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1021-gcp - 6.8.0-1021.23
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1017-gke - 6.8.0-1017.21
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1019-ibm - 6.8.0-1019.19
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-52-lowlatency - 6.8.0-52.53.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-52-lowlatency-64k - 6.8.0-52.53.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1019-oracle - 6.8.0-1019.20
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1019-oracle-64k - 6.8.0-1019.20
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1020-oem - 6.8.0-1020.20
No subscription required

No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-intel - 6.8.0-1018.25
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-52.53').
linux-aws package in noble is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '6.8.0-1022.24').
linux-azure package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-1021.25').
linux-gcp package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-1021.23').
linux-gke package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-1017.21').
linux-ibm package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-1019.19').
linux-lowlatency package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-52.53.1').
linux-oracle package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-1019.20').
linux-oem-6.8 package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-1020.20').
linux-raspi package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-1018.20').
linux-intel package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-1018.25').
